metadata.title: SF DBI Electronic Plan Review (EPR) Requirements
metadata.source: SF DBI EPR Guidelines (Exhibit F) + Bluebeam Usage Guide
metadata.context: DBI transitioned to 100% Electronic Plan Review for In-House Review projects. All plans reviewed in Bluebeam. Non-compliant submissions will be delayed or rejected.

epr_mandate.regulatory_basis: Administrative Bulletin AB-004, Section on Concurrent Review
epr_mandate.quote: The applicant of a priority project shall be required to submit plans for electronic plan review (EPR) to avail of concurrent plan review.
epr_mandate.current_status: As of January 1, 2024, ALL plan submissions to DBI must be electronic — EPR is no longer limited to priority projects

submission_platform.name: Bluebeam Studio
submission_platform.note: All in-house review plans are reviewed in Bluebeam Studio sessions

drawing_production.detail: Plan drawings created in CAD programs must use vector-based lines. Must line up when overlaid electronically. Scanned/raster drawings are not acceptable for plan review.
drawing_production.common_violation: Architects scanning hand-drawn markups instead of CAD output

drawing_production.detail: Use TrueType or OpenType fonts to create searchable text within the document. SHX fonts (AutoCAD default) are allowed only if you run batch OCR on the drawing set with Bluebeam eXtreme afterward.
drawing_production.common_violation: AutoCAD SHX fonts creating non-searchable text — plan checkers can't search for code references

drawing_production.detail: All drawing sheets must be in one consolidated PDF file per document type. Do not submit individual sheet PDFs.
drawing_production.common_violation: Submitting separate PDFs for each sheet

drawing_production.detail: Plot or print drawing sheets at full 1:1 scale from authoring software. Also called 100% or 'to scale' output. Do NOT use 'scale to fit' printing.
drawing_production.common_violation: Printing to letter-size PDF instead of arch-size — makes dimensions unreadable in Bluebeam

drawing_production.detail: Drawing sheets must be at least 22" x 34" (ANSI D or Arch D). Larger sheets accepted. Exception: signage permits accept 11" x 17". Supplemental forms/documents at 8.5" x 11".
drawing_production.common_violation: Entire set printed at 11x17 — too small for plan review markup

drawing_production.detail: Each uploaded file must be less than 250MB. For site permit addenda, limit is 350MB.
drawing_production.common_violation: High-resolution raster images embedded in plan set inflating file size

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.rule: Bookmarks with page number and sheet name
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Add bookmarks for each sheet with format: 'A0.0 - COVER SHEET'. Calculations do not need bookmarks. DBI says 'We do not require bookmarks' but 'Reviewers can work faster if you add them.'
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: No bookmarks — plan checkers have to scroll through 50+ pages manually

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Drawings shall have page labels in the Thumbnail tab containing sheet number and name. Labels must match bookmark labels.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: Default numeric page labels instead of sheet numbers

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.rule: PDF must be unlocked and editable
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Do not submit locked, password-protected, encrypted, or 'restricted' documents. Bluebeam needs to add markup, comments, and stamps.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: PDF exported with security restrictions from Adobe Acrobat

pdf_metadata_and_navigation.detail: Do not use certificate-type digital signatures. This will lock the file and delay permit approval. Use scanned graphic signatures instead.
pdf_metadata_and_navigation.common_violation: Engineer using Adobe Sign or DocuSign certificate signature — locks the PDF for Bluebeam

cover_sheet.rule: Total page count on cover sheet
cover_sheet.detail: Cover sheets must have a total page count that matches the actual PDF page count.
cover_sheet.common_violation: Cover says '12 sheets' but PDF has 14 pages

cover_sheet.rule: 8.5" x 11" blank area on cover sheet
cover_sheet.detail: Cover sheets must contain a blank area that is 8.5" wide x 11" tall for DBI stamping and permit information.
cover_sheet.common_violation: Cover sheet completely filled with project info — no room for DBI permit stamp

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the project address on every sheet in the entire set.
title_block.common_violation: Address on cover but missing from individual drawing sheets

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the sheet number on every sheet.
title_block.common_violation: Unnumbered supplemental pages mixed into drawing set

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have the sheet name (description) on every sheet.
title_block.common_violation: Sheet numbers present but no descriptive names

title_block.rule: 2" x 2" blank area on every sheet title block
title_block.detail: A blank area at least 2" wide x 2" tall must appear in the same location on every sheet's title block. Used for reviewer stamps and approval marks.
title_block.common_violation: Title block completely filled — reviewer has to stamp over existing content

title_block.detail: Title blocks must have 3 consistent items on every sheet in the entire set (typically: project address, firm name/logo, and sheet numbering format).
title_block.common_violation: Mixed title block formats when structural engineer uses different template than architect

signatures_and_stamps.rule: Design professional signature and stamp on every sheet
signatures_and_stamps.detail: Every sheet must have your signature and stamp. Use a scanned graphic signature with a PDF stamp. Scan a .PNG file with transparent background for best results.
signatures_and_stamps.common_violation: Unsigned sheets — especially supplemental calculation pages

signatures_and_stamps.rule: Flatten PDF after adding graphic signatures
signatures_and_stamps.detail: If you add a graphic stamp or signature after creating the PDF, flatten the PDF to embed the images. Unflattened stamps can be moved or deleted in Bluebeam.
signatures_and_stamps.common_violation: Stamp added as Bluebeam annotation instead of flattened into page

file_naming.detail: Format: [Number Prefix]-[Document type]-[Revision Number] [Street address]_[Type/Count of Addenda]. If no application number yet, use street address. 6 accepted document types with number prefixes.
file_naming.common_violation: Files named 'plans_final_v3.pdf' instead of following convention

bluebeam_specific.detail: You must add DBI's Back Check page PDF to submit plans in Bluebeam. This is a standardized page for tracking review comments and responses.
bluebeam_specific.common_violation: Forgetting to append the back check page template

bluebeam_specific.rule: Dense hatching may cause rendering issues
bluebeam_specific.detail: Not an official DBI rule, but dense cross-hatching patterns cause slow rendering and lag in Bluebeam Studio sessions. Plan checkers may request simplified hatching.
bluebeam_specific.common_violation: Dense material hatching patterns causing Bluebeam to freeze during markup

severity_levels.reject: DBI will not process the submission. Must fix before filing.
severity_levels.warning: DBI may accept but will likely issue a correction letter. Fix to avoid delays.
severity_levels.recommendation: Not required but significantly improves review speed and reduces friction.

pre_submission_checks: All sheets in single consolidated PDF [EPR-003]
Minimum sheet size 22" x 34" for drawings [EPR-005]
PDF unlocked — no encryption or passwords [EPR-009]
8.5" x 11" blank area on cover sheet [EPR-012]
Design professional signature/stamp on every sheet [EPR-018]
Flatten PDF after adding graphic signatures [EPR-019]

format_requirements.confidence: high — sourced from official DBI EPR Guidelines (Exhibit F)

requirements.details: CAD-produced vector lines, not scanned images. Non-compliant = rejection.
Searchable text required. SHX fonts need OCR post-processing.
One PDF per document type. No individual sheet files.
Print at 100% scale from authoring software.
ANSI D or Arch D minimum. Signage permits: 11x17. Supplements: 8.5x11.
Per upload. Site permit addenda: 350MB limit.
No encryption, passwords, or security restrictions.
Use scanned graphic signatures. DocuSign/Adobe Sign certificates lock the PDF.
DBI standardized Back Check page appended to plan set.

cover_sheet: Project scope description matching permit application
Code references (Building Code edition, Fire Code, Accessibility)
Total page count matching actual PDF pages [EPR-011]
8.5" x 11" blank area for DBI stamping [EPR-012]
title_block_every_sheet: 2" x 2" blank area for reviewer stamps [EPR-016]
architectural_plans: Sections showing existing and proposed conditions

submission_copies.otc_review: Submit via PermitSF portal — electronic only as of Jan 2024
submission_copies.in_house_review: Submit via PermitSF portal for electronic plan review in Bluebeam
submission_copies.note: Physical paper plans are no longer accepted for initial submission

decision_tree_integration.step_5_connection: EPR format requirements apply to ALL documents listed in decision tree Step 5
decision_tree_integration.otc_implications: Some OTC 'no plans' permits (Form 8) do not require plan drawings but still use electronic submission
decision_tree_integration.in_house_implications: In-house review plans must be EPR-formatted for multi-agency concurrent review in Bluebeam Studio
